Reviews.Title: A very good satellite phone!
Reviews.Author: A. Keller
Reviews.Content: I used this phone in Rwanda, Africa, and it worked very well. Sound quality is satisfying. Battery life is excellent. Looks quite big, but I carried it two weeks in my cargo pants without any problem.It's definitely a very good satellite phone.

Reviews.Title: Desert tested!
Reviews.Author: J.
Reviews.Content: I just took it for a test run last week in the middle of the desert, 40 miles away from the closest town.  It worked perfectly, cellphone quality sound. Battery lasts quite a bit, plus you can charge it using USB. Not as big as it looks and it is quite rugged, had it in the tool compartment while off roading, woked fine in 100 degree heat.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!
Reviews.Author: MSDC
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid hikker and have used different sattelite phones in my many treks. From Globalstar to Iridium, I've used them all. All of them usually required a spot were the signal was good and to be very still. I have used this phone from a moving car while crossing over the Andes with very good reception. I have also used it in the middle of the desert in Peru, in a hike over the Callejon de Huaylas in Peru and in the middle of nowhere in Costa Rica. I'm very happy with this phone.

Reviews.Title: The best deal for a satphone
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Staton
Reviews.Content: The sound quality is similar to a cell phone.  Not the same, just different.  I think it sounds "cleaner" than a cell phone, but slightly robotic sometimes.  Once you have a good signal, it will not drop the call.  Other carriers tend to drop calls a lot because their satellites are constantly moving and are often near the horizon.  It does text messaging, short emails, and twitter, using the numeric keypad.  It's great for emergencies, hiking, or international travel.  Like all satellite phones, it's not designed to work indoors, but I've been able to make calls indoors anyway!  Or, if you can get a signal by a window, you can use a bluetooth headset to extend the indoor range. I have used this bluetooth handset with mine: New TK2 Mini Bluetooth Handset White, working with iPhone,iPad,Smart Phone,Tablet PC,PC NoteBook,MID,Voip,Messenger,Skype

Reviews.Title: No More Two Year prepaid options, Max is one year.
Reviews.Author: Steven M.
Reviews.Content: The phone works great, but the description is old and does not take into account the fact that Inmarsat no longer offers a 2 year prepaid plan. The max length of a prepaid plan is now 1 year. You have to buy 500 minutes to get a plan that lasts a year. Anything less than 500 minutes is good for 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Great SAT phone-speakerphone not good
Reviews.Author: Satphoneguy
Reviews.Content: The voice quality is excellent. It is made very well...sturdy. I do not like the speakerphone. It needs to be much louder. I just received my first bill-no surprises.

Reviews.Title: Life Saver
Reviews.Author: Richard Leatherwood
Reviews.Content: In Oregon you can find yourself deep in the forest with no cell service.If you need medical or have car issues this is your lifesaver.Was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Does the job...
Reviews.Author: dmcoopknx
Reviews.Content: This phone makes calls but is more picky about getting it pointed at the satellite than I expected. Also, since I bought it on Amazon INMARSAT had trouble activating it. They had to ship a new SIM card to me for it to activate.
